enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Object Uses Only Own Static Lightmap
Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps On Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object uses parent's markers

bit.name: Sample Environment Lighting Only Ignore Object Lighting
Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer
Does Not Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Force Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Damage Not Blocked By Obstructions
bit.tooltip: AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.

bit.name: Grab Parent Object In Forge Editing
Never Use Imposter For Shadow Generation

float32.name: Bounding Radius
float32.tooltip: If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

tagRef.name: Collision Damage
tagRef.tooltip: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

tagRef.name: Melee Sound
tagRef.tooltip: this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

float32.name: Self-Destruct Time
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.

stringid.name: Interaction Name
stringid.tooltip: if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

bit.name: Always Exports Value
bit.tooltip: when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value

bit.name: Turn Off With Uses Magnitude
bit.tooltip: the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

stringid.name: Import Name
stringid.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringid.name: Turn Off With
stringid.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

stringid.name: Ranged Interpolation Name
stringid.tooltip: if you have the ranged button checked

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

tagblock.name: Interpolation

option.name: Fractional
option.tooltip: covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

float32.name: Linear Travel Time
float32.tooltip: used by constant velocity

float32.name: Acceleration
float32.tooltip: used by linear acceleration

tagblock.comment: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

float32.name: Spring k
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines acceleration by displacement

float32.name: Spring c
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines damping based on velocity

float32.name: Fraction
float32.tooltip: used by fractional, how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

int32.name: Runtime Interpolator To Object Function Mapping

rangef.name: Selection Bounds
rangef.tooltip: if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

bit.name: Update State Animation and Keyframe Rigid Bodies Every Frame
Force Always On
bit.tooltip: when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string

bit.name: Effect Size Scale From Object Scale
Works On Land
bit.tooltip: drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

stringId.name: Variant Name
stringId.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

tagblock.name: Multiplayer Object

flags8.name: Game Engine Flags
flags8.tooltip: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in

tagblock.comment: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

tagblock.name: Falloff Function
tagblock.tooltip: Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

tagblock.comment: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient

tagref.name: Spawned Object
tagref.tooltip: If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagref.name: Simulation Interpolation
tagref.tooltip: Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

tagblock.name: Spawn Effects
tagblock.comment: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

tagRef.name: Multiplayer Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in MP games

tagRef.name: Survival Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games

tagRef.name: Campaign Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

bit.name: Detonation Maximum Time If Attached
bit.tooltip: If attach happens timeout is set to timer.high

bit.name: Robotron Steering
bit.tooltip: or robotech, maybe

bit.name: Allow Deceleration Below Final Velocity
bit.tooltip: use for bouncing projectiles that also have initial/final velocity so that can reliably come to rest.

bit.name: Supports Tethering
bit.tooltip: projectile waits for trigger unlatch before immediately detonating

bit.name: Damage Not Predictable By Clients
bit.tooltip: used on the focus rifle to disable observer shield flash prediction for a high-dps weapon that does low damage per projectile

bit.name: Collides With Physics-Only Surfaces
bit.tooltip: aka sphere-only collision. Use this for projectiles that you want to bounce smoothly up stairs, but don't use it for projectiles that may come to rest on stairs

bit.name: Detonates When Attached To Objects
bit.tooltip: when projectiles move slowly enough they attach to objects or come to rest. Check this for projectiles that don't normally attach to things like frag grenades

bit.name: Cannot Be Detached By Equipment
bit.tooltip: armor lock will not detach these projectiles - for the airstrike

bit.name: Does Not Collide With World Geometry
bit.tooltip: this gun shoots through schools

bit.name: Is Collectible
bit.tooltip: Projectile is collectible by projectile collector equipment

bit.name: Continuous Damage While Attached and Tethered
Combinations Of Projectiles From Different Weapons Or Different Bursts Of The Same Weapon Will Not Trigger Super Combine Detonation
Distance Based Damage Scaling Uses Damage Range Low Bounds
bit.tooltip: damage scales from 1.f --> 0.f between 'damage range - low' --> 'damage range - high'

bit.name: Skip Object First Tick
bit.tooltip: similar to Disable instantaneous first tick, but there's actually two types of ticks

bit.name: Use Projectile Radius For Thickness Testing
bit.tooltip: IF THIS IS OFF, NO THICKNESS OR CHUBBY TESTS ARE PERFORMED.

bit.name: Expensive Chubby Test
bit.tooltip: Will only be active if thickness testing is ON.

bit.name: Use Play Collision
bit.tooltip: Will use simple and smooth collision mesh.

bit.name: Highlight Projectile In Vision Mode
bit.tooltip: Makes the projectile show up as an enemy in vision mode

bit.name: Biped Proximity Enemies Only
bit.tooltip: modifies behavior of 'detonation biped proximity'

bit.name: Always Use Localized Physics
bit.tooltip: overrides early mover localize projectiles

bit.name: Never Use Localized Physics
bit.tooltip: overrides early mover localize projectiles

option.name: After First Bounce Off Any Surface
Silent
option.tooltip: ai will not respond to this sound

option.name: Loud
option.tooltip: ai can hear this sound at any range

float32.name: Detonation Biped Proximity
float32.tooltip: if >0, both 'detonation timer starts' + a biped must be within this proximity for condition to be met; see 'biped proximity enemies only' flag

float32.name: Maximum Lifetime To Detonate
float32.tooltip: if >0, projectile will detonate regardless of other conditions after this total time

float32.name: Arming Time
float32.tooltip: won't detonate before this time elapses

float32.name: Danger Stimuli Radius
float32.tooltip: Overrides the danger radius when non-zero for stimuli related danger radius calculations.

int16.name: Danger Group Burst Count
int16.tooltip: The number of projectiles in this burst before this burst is considered dangerous

int16.name: Danger Group Burst Maximum Count
int16.tooltip: The maximum number of projectiles we allow in a group

float32.name: Minimum Velocity
float32.tooltip: detonates when slowed below this velocity

float32.name: Maximum Range
float32.tooltip: detonates after travelling this distance

float32.name: Bounce Maximum Range
float32.tooltip: detonates after travelling this distance, but is reset after a bounce. Combines with maximum range

float32.name: Maximum Latch Time To Detonate
float32.tooltip: projectile will detonate regardless of weapon latching after this total time

float32.name: Maximum Latch Time To Arm
float32.tooltip: projectile will arm itself regardless of detonation mode if latched for this amount of time.

option.name: Silent
option.tooltip: ai will not respond to this sound

option.name: Loud
option.tooltip: ai can hear this sound at any range

rangef.name: Super Detonation Range
rangef.tooltip: The range within which supercombine will happen - outside this range, no supercombine

tagref.name: Super Detonation Behavior
tagref.tooltip: An equipment reference that is attached to the target upon super detonation

float32.name: Tether Release Safety Delay
float32.tooltip: if the weapon the projectile is tethered to loses its owner, this amount of time will pass before detonation

plugin.comment: A detonating tethered projectile attached to an object will use the 'super' versions of damage ie 'super attached detonation damage' instead of 'attached detonation damage'.

tagref.name: Detonation Behavior
tagref.tooltip: An equipment reference that is attached to the target upon detonation

float32.name: Material Effect Radius
float32.tooltip: radius within we will generate material effects

plugin.comment: damage range low is unused unless 'distance based damage scaling uses damage range low bounds' flag is true.

float32.name: Air Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: the proportion of normal gravity applied to the projectile when in air.

rangef.name: Air Damage Range
rangef.tooltip: the range over which damage is scaled when the projectile is in air.

float32.name: Water Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: the proportion of normal gravity applied to the projectile when in water.

rangef.name: Water Damage Range
rangef.tooltip: the range over which damage is scaled when the projectile is in water.

float32.name: Initial Velocity
float32.tooltip: bullet's velocity when inflicting maximum damage

float32.name: Final Velocity
float32.tooltip: bullet's velocity when inflicting minimum damage

float32.name: Indirect Fire Velocity
float32.tooltip: base velocity used for ballistics calculations for indirect firing.

float32.name: AI Normal Velocity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on normal difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0

float32.name: AI Heroic Velocity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on heroic difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)

float32.name: AI Legendary Velocity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the initial velocity when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)

float32.name: AI Normal Guided Angular Velocity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the guided angular velocity when fired by the ai on normal difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0

float32.name: AI Legendary Guided Angular Velocity Scale
float32.tooltip: scale on the guided angular velocity when fired by the ai on legendary difficulty (0 defaults to 1.0)

rangef.name: Acceleration Range
rangef.tooltip: what distance range the projectile goes from initial velocity to final velocity

float32.name: Guided Projectile Outer Range Error Radius

tagblock.name: Old Material Responses
tagblock.comment: if the potential result, below, fails to happen

degree.name: Angular Noise
degree.tooltip: the angle of incidence is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

float32.name: Velocity Noise
float32.tooltip: the velocity is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

float32.name: Initial Friction
float32.tooltip: the fraction of the projectile's velocity lost on penetration

float32.name: Parallel Friction
float32.tooltip: the fraction of the projectile's velocity parallel to the surface lost on impact

float32.name: Perpendicular Friction
float32.tooltip: the fraction of the projectile's velocity perpendicular to the surface lost on impact

degree.name: Angular Noise
degree.tooltip: the angle of incidence is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

float32.name: Velocity Noise
float32.tooltip: the velocity is randomly perturbed by at most this amount to simulate irregularity.

float32.name: Initial Friction
float32.tooltip: the fraction of the projectile's velocity lost on penetration

float32.name: Parallel Friction
float32.tooltip: the fraction of the projectile's velocity parallel to the surface lost on impact

float32.name: Perpendicular Friction
float32.tooltip: the fraction of the projectile's velocity perpendicular to the surface lost on impact

float32.name: Angular Damping
float32.tooltip: 0==nothing 30==almost complete damping

tagblock.name: Conical Spread
tagblock.comment: projectile_count = yaw_count*pitch_count This block has no effect if _projectile_disable_instantaneous_first_tick is set or projectile has not been fired from a weapon.

float32.name: Distribution Exponent
float32.tooltip: exp==.5 even distribution, exp==1 halo2 distribution, exp>1== weighted towards center

tagref.name: Grounded Friction Settings
tagref.tooltip: If not present, the default from global.globals is used.

tagref.name: Killcam Parameters
tagref.tooltip: if not present, first person will be used.

int32.name: Attachment Index
int32.tooltip: Sound attachment to affect - leave empty for main body
